availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Young (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - Cpt. 5th Kentucky Inf. (C.S.A.))

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Young and Elizabeth Young. Married to Miranda Burbridge Young in Bath County, Kentucky, on October 3, 1848. Father of Edwin Young, Mary Young, William Young, John Young, and Nannie Young. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860. Served in the Fifth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a captain from September 22, 1862 to October 10, 1863.
